tweet: In the middle of this crazy, crazy time, it’s more important than ever to reach out to loved ones – and today, the spotlight is on Mom. Happy Mother’s Day to all of the mothers in Maine and across the country!
A simple proposal to assess and blunt the spread of the coronavirus: give all Americans the same testing regimen that the White House gets.

During this crisis, America’s nonprofits are stepping up to help those in need; it’s only right that Congress returns the favor. @SenatorLankford and I led 30 Senators in a letter to leadership, urging aid for charitable nonprofits in any future coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/6CrL74rg8d

State and local government services are vital to Maine – but they’re not free. As tax revenues continue to fall, these governments will be forced to either raise taxes or lay off workers. Neither is acceptable; the federal government must provide relief. https://t.co/CcRFGSr7Pk

This is HUGE news for Maine. Testing is the foundation of making sure we can keep Maine people safe and healthy as this crisis continues, and help inform how we get through it. Grateful for IDEXX's partnership and the steady leadership of @GovJanetMills during this crisis. https://t.co/peilWNNFD0
In challenging times – and I certainly think this qualifies – I look to my faith for strength and guidance. On this #NationalDayOfPrayer, I find myself turning to Psalm 23. https://t.co/lqHiDdYNZQ

Trying to “terminate” healthcare protections for Americans with pre-existing conditions is terrible; doubling down on this effort, amidst a global pandemic that has already killed tens of thousands of Americans, is even worse. We must protect the ACA. https://t.co/EFPKbExnHG

Maine’s nurses are heroes, plain and simple. Their tireless efforts – even in the face of personal risks – are critical to the health and safety of our people. On #NationalNursesDay, we give them all of our gratitude and more. 
 
Thank you, each and every one of you.

We’re in the midst of a crisis, and we need stronger federal leadership to help get through it. I’m cosponsoring legislation that would speed up production of life-saving PPE and testing materials because this isn’t about ideology; it’s about saving lives. https://t.co/jpgWdvW65g

Maine’s potatoes and wild blueberries are world-renowned products, and the industries surrounding them have supported Maine communities for generations. That's why I'm urging @USDA to provide tailored support for our farmers during this pandemic. https://t.co/Zbh2bzPiHI

The impact of coronavirus has hit America’s youth hard – but fortunately, we have heroes who are going above and beyond to offer support. Today is #NationalTeacherDay, so make sure to #ThankATeacher for the work they are doing to build brighter futures for our students.

The only way we can beat coronavirus is with facts and data – so it’s not helpful when the President removes people from their positions for telling the truth. We need our leaders to be seeking out all available information, not just cherry-picking the pieces they want to hear. https://t.co/rEbhdO5v1w

Beginning the day in Lewiston with a listening session at @SeniorsPlusOrg, followed by a discussion with the staff at the @ircofme on challenges Maine people face in accessing affordable healthcare. https://t.co/QCHVvrdBGR

Coronary heart disease is the leading cause of death in America, affecting approximately 88,000 Maine people – but it can be prevented. For #AmericanHeartMonth, let’s raise awareness about the disease and the best ways to keep your heart healthy. https://t.co/xuPjuRKisK

A pandemic disease emerging anywhere in the world is a threat to American public health – that’s why this week, I introduced a bill to create a permanent position on the National Security Council that would be charged with monitoring and preventing global health threats. https://t.co/qylQTLsJow

Today’s bipartisan passage of @TimKaine’s War Powers Resolution wasn’t about one president or one event – it’s about Congress reclaiming its Constitutionally-designated power to declare war. https://t.co/CSbdZ1NH9d

The Constitution makes it clear that Congress holds the power to declare war – but over the last 70 years, we’ve too often abdicated that responsibility. Today I joined @EdHenry to discuss the Senate’s bipartisan effort to reassert our Constitutionally-designated responsibility. https://t.co/KuQRX8Rs3B

It’s wrong for a president – any president – to taint the independence of our judicial system by bending the rules for a political ally. In America, we have one set of laws, and no one is above them – if we abandon that principle, we abandon who we are.

Coronavirus is a serious threat to global health; it’s important to remember the flu also needs to be a concern – with nearly 5,000 cases in Maine this season. I'm working with officials and pressing the administration for updates and answers on both. https://t.co/2TM38tpZhz
